name: leviathan

procedures: T1003.001::[Leviathan] has used publicly available tools to dump password hashes, including ProcDump and WCE.
T1003::[Leviathan] has used publicly available tools to dump password hashes, including [HOMEFRY].
T1021.001::[Leviathan] has targeted RDP credentials and used it to move through the victim environment.
T1021.004::[Leviathan] used ssh for internal reconnaissance.
T1027.001::[Leviathan] has inserted garbage characters into code, presumably to avoid anti-virus detection.
T1027.003::[Leviathan] has used steganography to hide stolen data inside other files stored on Github.
T1027::[Leviathan] has obfuscated code using base64 and gzip compression.
T1041::[Leviathan] has exfiltrated data over its C2 channel.
T1047::[Leviathan] has used WMI for execution.
T1055.001::[Leviathan] has utilized techniques like reflective DLL loading to write a DLL into memory and load a shell that provides backdoor access to the victim.
T1059.001::[Leviathan] has used PowerShell for execution.
T1059.005::[Leviathan] has used VBScript.
T1074.001::[Leviathan] has used C:\Windows\Debug and C:\Perflogs as staging directories.
T1074.002::[Leviathan] has staged data remotely prior to exfiltration.
T1078::[Leviathan] has obtained valid accounts to gain initial access.
T1090.003::[Leviathan] has used multi-hop proxies to disguise the source of their malicious traffic.

T1140::[Leviathan] has used a DLL known as SeDll to decrypt and execute other JavaScript backdoors.
T1189::[Leviathan] has infected victims using watering holes.
T1197::[Leviathan] has used [BITSAdmin] to download additional tools.

T1204.001::[Leviathan] has sent spearphishing email links attempting to get a user to click.
T1204.002::[Leviathan] has sent spearphishing attachments attempting to get a user to click.
T1218.010::[Leviathan] has used regsvr32 for execution.
T1505.003::[Leviathan] relies on web shells for an initial foothold as well as persistence into the victim's systems.
T1534::[Leviathan] has conducted internal spearphishing within the victim's environment for lateral movement.
T1546.003::[Leviathan] has used WMI for persistence.
T1547.001::[Leviathan] has used JavaScript to create a shortcut file in the Startup folder that points to its main backdoor.
T1547.009::[Leviathan] has used JavaScript to create a shortcut file in the Startup folder that points to its main backdoor.
T1553.002::[Leviathan] has used stolen code signing certificates to sign malware.
T1559.002::[Leviathan] has utilized OLE as a method to insert malicious content inside various phishing documents.
T1560::[Leviathan] has archived victim's data prior to exfiltration.
T1566.001::[Leviathan] has sent spearphishing emails with malicious attachments, including .rtf, .doc, and .xls files.
T1566.002::[Leviathan] has sent spearphishing emails with links, often using a fraudulent lookalike domain and stolen branding.
T1567.002::[Leviathan] has used an uploader known as LUNCHMONEY that can exfiltrate files to Dropbox.
T1572::[Leviathan] has used protocol tunneling to further conceal C2 communications and infrastructure.
T1583.001::[Leviathan] has established domains that impersonate legitimate entities to use for targeting efforts.
T1585.001::[Leviathan] has created new social media accounts for targeting efforts.
T1585.002::[Leviathan] has created new email accounts for targeting efforts.
T1586.001::[Leviathan] has compromised social media accounts to conduct social engineering attacks.
T1586.002::[Leviathan] has compromised email accounts to conduct social engineering attacks.
T1589.001::[Leviathan] has collected compromised credentials to use for targeting efforts.

description: [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) is a Chinese state-sponsored cyber espionage group that has been attributed to the Ministry of State Security's (MSS) Hainan State Security Department and an affiliated front company.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021) Active since at least 2009, [Leviathan](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0065) has targeted the following sectors: academia, aerospace/aviation, biomedical, defense industrial base, government, healthcare, manufacturing, maritime, and transportation across the US, Canada, Europe, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia.(Citation: CISA AA21-200A APT40 July 2021)(Citation: Proofpoint Leviathan Oct 2017)(Citation: FireEye Periscope March 2018)
